info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:37PM EDT until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF SCREVEN AND ALLENDALE COUNTIES... At 336 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Burtons Ferry Landing, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include: Allendale, Fairfax, Sycamore, Ulmer, Seigling, Millett, Martin, Barton, Millhaven, Appleton and Burtons Ferry Landing. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
